name: d365fo-debugging
description: Complete D365 Finance & Operations debugging framework. Routes symptoms to correct playbook (Finance, SCM, WMS, Batch, Security, Integration, Performance, Reporting). Activates for D365, Dynamics, AX, voucher, posting, batch job, SSRS, DMF, work order, wave, security, can't post, missing, wrong amount, slow, stuck.

inputs.name: businessKey
inputs.description: Document/record ID (SO number, PO, Invoice, Voucher, WorkId, etc.)

inputs.name: symptom
inputs.description: What's wrong (missing, wrong amount, can't post, slow, etc.)

mcpDependencies.description: Execute SQL queries for schema discovery and data inspection

antiHallucination: SCHEMA FIRST: NEVER guess columns. Run SELECT TOP 1 * before any filtered query
NO HARD-CODED FILTERS: NEVER hard-code DATAAREAID without validation
PLATINUM RULE: ALWAYS find a WORKING example and DIFF it
DIAMOND RULE: Check FULL STACK: UI/Form -> Business Logic -> Config -> Batch/Report/Integration
LINE CONTAMINATION: One bad LINE can override the entire HEADER classification
STOP CONDITIONS: If not found after 3 queries -> pivot upstream/downstream
verificationChecklist: Analyzed FULL STACK: Filter Layer -> Logic Layer -> Configuration (Diamond Rule)
Traced Configuration Lineage: Header -> Line -> ConfigTable
Checked for LINE CONTAMINATION: Did a single line force Header classification?
Verified table has DATAAREAID before applying legal entity filter
Found WORKING example to compare against (Platinum Rule)
Diffed bad vs good records - identified field that differs
Checked Stop Conditions - pivoted if necessary
